subject: Law
title: When Is War Legal?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on When Is War Legal?.

hook.text: Russia invades Ukraine. The US invades Iraq. One was condemned by the UN; the other debated. War's legality is complex.

buildup.text: The UN Charter bans force between states, with two exceptions: self-defense and Security Council authorization.

discovery.text: Self-defense under Article 51 must be in response to an armed attack. Preemptive war is highly contested.

twist.text: The Security Council can authorize forceâ€”but veto power means one permanent member can block action indefinitely.

climax.text: Humanitarian intervention without UN approval remains the most debated issue: illegal but sometimes morally justified?

punchline.text: War is banned by default. The exceptions define when nations can fight.

quiz.question: Under the UN Charter, what are the two legal justifications for war?
